item.title: Getting Your First CS Co-op
item.description: Disclaimer: This guide is mainly intended for those aiming to get a computer science internship. I don’t know anything outside these areas, but I’m pretty sure some of the ideas presented here can still be relevant to these other areas.

item.title: Term Review - Spring 2023
item.description: Intro Spring 2023 is the term where I’m actively seeking for coop + working as a TA + being involved with some organizations.

item.title: University Transfer - Benefits and Tips
item.description: Note: This post has the same content from this sfu blog. I cross-post it as I was the writer and want to provide more content to my personal website.

item.title: Term Review - Fall 2022
item.description: Intro Fall 2022 has been quite a rough ride as it’s my first time taking 4 CMPT courses. There were some moments where I didn’t get the time to revise some content, but overall, this term was pretty good.

item.title: Term Review - Summer 2022
item.description: Intro Term Review is an every-4-month journal to share all my thoughts and experiences during the finished term. It acts as both my journal and course review (for those who are planning to take similar courses).

item.title: Langara CS to SFU CS/ SoSy Transfer Guide
item.description: Last Updated: 28 June 2022 Introduction Hello! My name is Brian. I have just transferred to Simon Fraser University’s Software Systems program this summer after graduating from Langara with an Associate in Computer Science.

item.title: Why you should write more ✍(◔◡◔)
item.description: In my transition period from junior high to high school years, I used to be paid to write. Sounds cool at first, until I told everyone that I am just writing for a game guide.

item.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
item.description: Self-help advice which tells you to become the person you want to be only reinforces the idea that you are not that thing Pursuing something only reinforces that you lack it in the first place.

item.title: The Almanack of Naval Ravikant
item.description: Building Wealth Understand How Wealth Is Created It’s not really about hard work. You can work in a restaurant eighty hours a week, and you’re not going to get rich.

item.title: Deep Work
item.description: “The ability to perform deep work is becoming increasingly rare at exactly the same time it is becoming increasingly valuable in our economy.

item.title: 7 Habits of Highly Effective Teens
item.description: We need a paradigm, paradigm is the way you see something, your point of view. Paradigms need to be principle-centered

item.title: How to Become a Straight-A Student
item.description: “The simple truth is that the brute force techniques used by most students are incredibly inefficient.” - Cal Newport

item.title: Atomic Habits
item.description: ”We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence is not an act, but a habit.” - Aristotle “The costs of your good habits are in the present.
